title: Attempting to create throws TypeError: argument should be a path or str object, not <class 'NoneType'>
body:
## Expected behavior

Using the create function through the following command: "python C:\Users\Carson\Desktop\DeepFaceLab-master\main.py convert --output-dir C:\face-swap\outputs --input-dir C:\face-swap\data\scene --model-dir C:\face-swap\models\LIAEF128 --model LIAEF128", where the output-dir argument is my destination for the newly generated swapped images and the input-dir argument is the full set of images from the video onto which new faces will be drawn.

## Actual behavior

The following error occurs:

> (face-swap) C:\Users\Carson>python C:\Users\Carson\Desktop\DeepFaceLab-master\main.py convert --output-dir C:\face-swap\outputs --input-dir C:\face-swap\data\scene --model-dir C:\face-swap\models\LIAEF128 --model LIAEF128
Running converter.
Error: argument should be a path or str object, not <class 'NoneType'>
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\Carson\Desktop\DeepFaceLab-master\mainscripts\Converter.py", line 213, in main
    aligned_path = Path(aligned_dir)
  File "C:\Users\Carson\Anaconda3\envs\face-swap\lib\pathlib.py", line 969, in __new__
    self = cls._from_parts(args, init=False)
  File "C:\Users\Carson\Anaconda3\envs\face-swap\lib\pathlib.py", line 651, in _from_parts
    drv, root, parts = self._parse_args(args)
  File "C:\Users\Carson\Anaconda3\envs\face-swap\lib\pathlib.py", line 643, in _parse_args
    % type(a))
TypeError: argument should be a path or str object, not <class 'NoneType'>

## Steps to reproduce

I generated this model with batch size 4 and extracted the images using the tools provided by DeepFaceLab.

## Other relevant information
It looks like some sort of alignment data is required for this to function, even though the --aligned-dir argument is shown as optional in the usage. I couldn't find any explanation for what the aligned directory was or what generated it, so I'm stuck.

I don't believe this is a major bug, it's a mix of me not knowing what the alignment data is supposed to be as well as the command not requiring it as an input in order to launch, thus generating an exception.
